title.narrative: Preservation Of Historic Buildings In Old Lebanese Towns Occupied By Displaced Population, Enhancing Their Housing Conditions

description.narrative:
Findings of the Neighbourhood Profiling, show that residents in both neighbourhoods, mainly males, work as daily labourers, street vendors, or run micro businesses, mostly in the informal sector. Female residents are rarely active in the labour market.. The Project will promote job opportunities to dwellers, mainly youth by engaging them in restoration works (males), or work as guides (males/females) in proposed historic trails. While contributing to generate more income opportunities for poor families, this will also provide critical employment chances for youth currently without future prospects and at risk for recruitment into local gangs/sectarian fractions and engagement in violent activities.
The Project will complement other efforts taking place over the past years. The Cultural Heritage Project, funded by the World Bank, focuses on the restoration of shops and public buildings, aiming to enhance economic activities in historic neighbourhoods.
The Project will furthermore complement already initiated activities by UN-Habitat, focusing on upgrading water, sanitation and storm water infrastructure to enhance service delivery and reduce further negative structural degradation of buildings (through funding from the Governments of Italy and Norway). Both Azm Saade and DPNA has been partner to these ongoing projects, and UN-Habitat will capitalize on their recent experience of raising awareness of dwellers and shops' owners on the social and financial value of historic buildings.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Enhanced awareness on sustainable urban development among the public and the media

description.narrative: Enhanced awareness on sustainable urban development among the public and the media

title.narrative: Local communities are aware of the value of the historic places they live in and are positively impact by the project. 6 Engineers from both municipalities will be trained on maintaining historic buildings and cultural heritage. 4,000 inhabitants will their awareness raised on the importance of the cultural heritage in Haddadine and old Saida.

title.narrative: Local and national governments and other Habitat Agenda Partners have strengthened capacity to develop policies and strategies for inclusive and participatory urban governance, and increased urban safety

description.narrative: Local and national governments and other Habitat Agenda Partners have strengthened capacity to develop policies and strategies for inclusive and participatory urban governance, and increased urban safety

title.narrative: 20 volunteers to be trained to raise awareness. 4,000 inhabitants will their awareness raised on the importance of the cultural heritage in Haddadine and old Saida. 20 youth males and females from the two local communities to be trained as guides to lead visitors coming to the area.

description.narrative: 20 volunteers to be trained to raise awareness. 4,000 inhabitants will their awareness raised on the importance of the cultural heritage in Haddadine and old Saida. 20 youth males and females from the two local communities to be trained as guides to lead visitors coming to the area.

title.narrative: Strengthened capacities of city institutions to develop plans and designs for compact, socially inclusive, integrated and connected cities and neighbourhoods

description.narrative: Strengthened capacities of city institutions to develop plans and designs for compact, socially inclusive, integrated and connected cities and neighbourhoods

title.narrative: 400 linear meters of infrastructure rehabilitation (Waste Water, Storm Water, Electricity, Roads and claddings). This will minimise further damage to historic buildings and stabilise structures. 36 Buildings to be rehabilitated (exterior and interior). 4,000 meters of historical trails with 40 story telling poles. In Haddadine, one Mameluke Mosque (Al Moallaq Mosque) along with buildings that are on the official list of Cultural Heritage preservation in "Tal'et el Ouainat" will be rehabilitated. In Saida, one old public bath (Hammam), and a number of mixed use commercial and residential heritage buildings in "Souk Al Hayyakin" (Street of Tailors) and Rue el Battah will be rehabilitated.
